summary: Valar dohaeris, all must serve, is a major aspect of Arya Stark's story and character arc. It's not something that goes to...
body:
Valar dohaeris, all must serve, is a major aspect of Arya Stark’s story and character arc. It’s not something that goes to another character while she is simplified down to death. Arya literally spends the bulk of her story serving others. Just a few examples:

  • She helped forage and work with the group of Night’s Watch recruits
  • When they were dwindled down to just her and a few other children, she actively tried to find food for others, helped carry a wounded Lommy, and spied ahead for danger.
  • In Harrenhal, she served as an actual slave, putting in hard labor before serving as a cupbearer
  • After getting herself and her friends out of Harrenhal, she actively protected them by back tracking to obscure their tracks and used her knowledge to guide them
  • She served a group of dying criminals water before another put them to death
  • She served a dying soldier water before someone else gave him a merciful death
  • When a thug who kidnapped abused her was wounded, she tended his wounds
  • In Braavos, she served another man water, helping him die (pattern?)
  • In the House of Black and White, she is a servant who cleans, helps with cooking, tends to the bodies of the dead, and serves as a cupbearer
  • She also starts working for Brusco selling seafood
  • When Sam is in danger, she protects him and gives him free food
  • As part of her job with the mummers, she serves the other actors, helping them with every little thing they need.

There are probably several things I’m missing, but long story short, Arya serves. She nurtures, leads, works, and fights. In short, she fits the concept of valar dohaeris far better than valar morghulis, though both are significant parts of her arc.

Stop simplifying Arya to just violence 2k19. She is so much more.

tags: the stark sisters: they're looking for a mind at work work
summary: I have this weird mental image of Sansa and Arya creating a "My Favorite Murder" style true crime podcast in a modern...
body:
I have this weird mental image of Sansa and Arya creating a “My Favorite Murder” style true crime podcast in a modern au.

Y'know, to cope with all the shit they’ve been through, and to teach others how to avoid sociopaths.

blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: every time I reread asoiaf books I'm drown in the feels for those two
summary: [...]Jon had their father's face, as she did. They were the only ones. Robb and Sansa and Bran and even little Rickon all took...
body:
[…]Jon had their father’s face, as she did. They were the only ones. Robb and Sansa and Bran and even little Rickon all took after the Tullys, with easy smiles and fire in their hair When Arya had been little, she had been afraid that meant that she was a bastard too. It had been Jon she had gone to in her fear, and Jon who had reassured her.

Arya I - A Game of Thrones.

This is an underrated quote regarding Arya and Jon that I really love. It shows the deep mutual love that exist between those two siblings. 

When little Arya was afraid that the similar features she shared with her half brother meant that she was a bastard, she turned to Jon for comfort. It’s not like Arya was alone in the world, she could turn to plenty of other people for reassurance:to her parents, to her other siblings, to the Old Nun or any other Stark loyal subject she was close to-  but she choose Jon. And Jon didn’t disappoint her. He was able to make her feel better by reassuring her that this wasn’t the case.  This quote highlights the impact Jon has in Arya’s life. That he has been her safe harbor and he always will be. After all, years later she says so herself “ Jon will want me even if no one else will”

Moving on to Jon, I think this quote is important for both his characterization and his relationship with Arya. A young Jon was faced with his even younger beloved sister being afraid that she was a bastard like him. While I’m sure that Arya meant no harm and just turned to her older brother for comfort because she trusted him, I’m also sure that Jon would feel hurt by her  confession. After all, his bastard status is always a sensitive topic for him. However, he didn’t let that affect him and instead reacted out to make Arya feel better. This says a lot about Jon’s selflessness (a trait that he shows often towards his siblings). Also, it speaks volumes about his love for Arya. Making Arya feel better is more important to him than his discomfort.

 Seriously, I really love those two and their beautiful bond.

body:
Birthday Request

Okay so my birthday is at the end of November and all I want is a bunch of new Game of Thrones tribute vids and music vids. Please? Save me through this long night~

blog.name: theladymeera
blog.title: I'm So Salty I'm a Pickle
blog.description:
Daenerys was my first fave and she will be my last.

Danielle, US. Meera is the frog queen of my heart but I post more about my dragon queen Dany. Trying to be a happy person against the will of all these nihilistic men.

This is my ASOIAF/GOT side blog. My main is a-mountain-girl, my booklr is readingaway.

tags: and so many others from other stories
i just don't have the energy to research and tag all those characters
summary: Behind every woman-warrior character is me, screaming excitedly and being generally useless while said character slays her...
body: Behind every woman-warrior character is me, screaming excitedly and being generally useless while said character slays her enemies.
